benchmark_details.name: R OBUST API
benchmark_details.overview: R OBUST API is a comprehensive benchmark to evaluate the reliability and robustness of code generated by large language models, focusing on API misuse in the generated code.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the reliability and robustness of code generation by large language models and study the API misuse behaviors.

data.source: 1208 coding questions collected from Stack Overflow involving 18 representative Java APIs.
data.annotation: Annotated based on common API misuse patterns.

methods: Static analysis using abstract syntax tree (AST)
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the proportion of API misuse cases to compilable code snippets.
methodology.interpretation: Lower API misuse rates indicate more reliable and robust code generation.
methodology.validation: The benchmark has been validated through experiments on multiple large language models including GPT-3.5 and GPT-4.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Open-source data available under a permissive license.
